intro: Spermacoce brachysepala, commonly known as the short-sepaled bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb with slender stems and opposite leaves. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, shiny seeds. Spermacoce brachysepala is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands.
